outputs.output_descr: The overall objective of this project is to provide conceptual framework for a programme development of IMPACT Centre to achieve long term full operational capacities. Another key objective is to develop Centre's organizational capacities and to introduce programme agenda to potential beneficiaries, stakeholders and the wider public. This project fits into the overall context of UNDP past and current efforts to improve democratic governance in Croatia, through policy advice and technical support, capacity development of institutions, promoting dialogue, and sharing of knowledge and best practices.

UNDP Regional Advisors' engagement in the countries of the Western Balkans is based primarily on supporting the countries' objective of accession into the European Union in the following areas of the EU acquis:  Chapter 11 Agriculture and Rural Development; Chapter 22 Regional Policy and Coordination of Structural Instruments; Chapter 23 Judiciary and Fundamental Rights; Chapter 24 Justice, Freedom, and Security.  These areas are directly related to UNDP's global strategic priorities and long-standing programmatic experience in these countries, primarily rule of law, including anti-corruption; environment; social inclusion; and regional and rural development. Moreover, through their network of experts, UNDP Regional Advisors facility responds to countries' requests related to all EU acquis areas.  The initiative is based in Zagreb, Croatia, and is implemented in Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia, Kosovo (under UNSCR 1244), Montenegro, Serbia and FYR Macedonia
